quotes.text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship, that makes unhappy marriages.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: No person would give up even an inch of their estate, and the slightest dispute with a neighbor can mean hell to pay; yet we easily let others encroach on our lives—worse, we often pave the way for those who will take it over. No person hands out their money to passersby, but to how many do each of us hand out our lives! We’re tight-fisted with property and money, yet think too little of wasting time, the one thing about which we should all be the toughest misers.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger
